connectMB.transferHex.manualDownload.value: If the file did not automatically download then

content.data.addActionWalkThrough.value: Name an action you want the micro:bit to recognise

content.data.addRecordingWalkThrough.value: Press to record a data sample or press button B on your micro:bit.

content.data.classHelpBody.value: The type of movement you want the machine learning tool to recognise e.g. 'wave' or 'clap'.

content.data.controlbar.button.clearData.value:
Are you sure you wish to delete all data samples?
This cannot be undone.

content.data.dataDescription.value: Multiple samples of movement data collected in approximately 2 second bursts.

content.index.dataWarning.subtitleOne.value: You have existing data samples and code that will be lost when you start a new session.

content.index.dataWarning.subtitleTwo.value: containing your data samples and code before continuing.

content.index.dataWarning.title.value: Existing data samples and code will be lost

content.model.output.action.descriptionB.value: The type of movement you want the machine learning tool to recognise e.g. ‘wave’ or ‘clap’.

content.model.output.certainty.descripti.value: How confident the model is that you are currently doing each action.

content.model.output.estimatedGesture.de.value: This is the action the model thinks you are currently doing.

content.model.output.output.descriptionB.value: What the micro:bit will do when each action is detected.

content.trainer.description.value: The computer program spots patterns or differences in your data samples, and uses these to build a mathematical model that allows the micro:bit machine learning tool to recognise different actions when you move your micro:bit.

content.trainer.failure.body.value: The training did not result in a usable model. The reason for this is most likely the data used for training. If the data samples for different actions are too similar, this can result in issues in the training process.

content.trainer.failure.todo.value: Return to the Add data page and change your data.

content.trainer.retrain.title.value: Status: Your data samples have changed. You can retrain the model.

disconnectedWarning.bluetooth1.value: The connection to the micro:bit has been lost.

disconnectedWarning.bluetooth3.value: is powered on (the red light on the back of the micro:bit should be on)

disconnectedWarning.bridge1.value: The connection to the micro:bit connected to your computer has been lost.

disconnectedWarning.remote1.value: The connection to the wireless micro:bit has been lost.

download-project-choose-microbit-subtitl.value: Downloading your project on to the same micro:bit will disconnect the micro:bit from the tool. You will need to reconnect the micro:bit if you want to record more data samples.

download-project-choose-microbit-title.value: Which micro:bit do you want to use?

download-project-intro-description.value: Your program includes the machine learning model you created. The model runs on the micro:bit so you can use it without being connected to the micro:bit machine learning tool.

download-project-intro-title.value: Download your machine learning MakeCode project

footer.helpContent.value: This graph shows movement data from the microbit’s accelerometer in real time. Try moving your connected micro:bit to see the X, Y and Z axes change.

homepage-subtitle.value: Introduce students to machine learning concepts through physical movement and data

insufficient-data-body.value: You need at least 3 data samples for 2 actions to train the model.

introducing-the-microbit-machine-learnin.value: Introducing the micro:bit machine learning tool

menu.trainer.notConnected1.value: You do not have a micro:bit connected

menu.trainer.notConnected2.value: Select the ‘Connect’ button to connect a micro:bit.

performanceWarning.content1.value: The quality of data being received from your micro:bit is low. This could be due to a connection issue.

performanceWarning.content2.value: Do you want to restart the connection process to try to improve performance?

popup.appVersionRedirect.button.redirect.value: I'm a UK primary school teacher

popup.appVersionRedirect.button.stay.value: I'm not a UK primary school teacher

popup.appVersionRedirect.explain.value: If you are a UK* primary school teacher, you will be redirected to the version of this tool designed for the UK's BBC micro:bit playground survey.

popup.appVersionRedirect.header.value: Are you a UK* primary school teacher?

popup.appVersionRedirect.uk.value: *includes crown dependencies Jersey, Guernsey and the Isle of Man

popup.compatibility.advice.value: We recommend Google Chrome or Microsoft Edge so you can connect directly to your micro:bit.

popup.compatibility.explain.value: Unfortunately, WebUSB and Web Bluetooth are not supported by this browser. This means you cannot connect to a micro:bit to record the data samples needed to train a machine learning model.

popup.outdatedmicrobit.header.value: Your micro:bit has an outdated machine learning tool program

popup.outdatedmicrobit.text.value: We strongly recommend that you update it now, as some features may not work as expected.

popup.outdatedmicrobit.text.mkcd.value: Open the newest MakeCode template to use the updated extension.

prototype.warning.value: This is a prototype version and is subject to change without notice

reconnectFailed.bluetooth1.value: The connection to the micro:bit could not be re-established.

reconnectFailed.bridge1.value: The connection to the micro:bit connected to your computer could not be re-established.

reconnectFailed.remote1.value: The connection to the wireless micro:bit could not be re-established.

reconnectFailed.subtitle.value: Follow these instructions to restart the connection process.

save-hex-dialog-heading.value: Save project as a hex file

save-hex-dialog-message1.value: The download contains your actions, data samples and your MakeCode project. Open it in the micro:bit machine learning tool to continue working.

save-hex-dialog-message2.value: You can also open it with Microsoft MakeCode if you don't need to change the actions and data samples.

saving-description.value: Your download will be ready soon.

saving-toast-title.value: Your hex file has been downloaded

sign-up.content.value: Welcome to our prototype of the micro:bit machine learning tool. We’d love you to try it out and give us your feedback. Please enter your email so we can keep you updated as it evolves.

sign-up.error.value: Something went wrong. Please try again or

sign-up.invalid.value: Please enter a valid email address

test-model-intro-description.value: Find out if it correctly recognises each action. Add more data to improve the model.

train-model-intro-description.value: Ask the computer to use your training samples to train the machine learning model to recognise different actions.
